title: 🔬 Tracking issue for generic associated types (GAT)

labels.name: B-RFC-approved
labels.description: Approved by a merged RFC but not yet implemented.

labels.name: A-associated-items
labels.description: Area: Associated items such as associated types and consts.

labels.name: T-lang
labels.description: Relevant to the language team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: B-unstable
labels.description: Implemented in the nightly compiler and unstable.

labels.name: C-tracking-issue
labels.description: Category: A tracking issue for an RFC or an unstable feature.

labels.name: requires-nightly
labels.description: This issue requires a nightly compiler in some way.

labels.name: S-tracking-ready-to-stabilize
labels.description: This is ready to stabilize; it may need a stabilization report and a PR

labels.name: T-types
labels.description: Relevant to the types team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: S-types-tracked
labels.description: Status: Being actively tracked by the types team

body:
This is a tracking issue for generic associated types (rust-lang/rfcs#1598)

# Repository

* Detailed tracking information is available at the [GAT initiative repository](https://rust-lang.github.io/generic-associated-types-initiative/)

# Unresolved questions:

* [x] https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/87479 -- defaults for `where Self: 'a`
* [x] https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/89122 -- where to put where clauses

# Blocking bugs

See also the [`GATs-blocking` tag](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3AGATs-blocking) (the list below *should* be a superset of that, but its good to double-check).

- [x] https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/62521
- [ ] ~~https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/30472~~ No longer blocking
